Description: Globular pottery bottle with narrow mouth and neck with one handle from shoulder to neck. Red-brown Nile silt fabric.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Nottingham Castle Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Very similar piece published from Naukratis, dated 7th to 5th century BC (Hogarth et. al. 1905, 125, fig. 5). Identical form published by Hogarth (Hogarth et. al. 1905, 125, Fig. 5.2) as Late Period.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IC.113)
